channel.title: African on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in African on ZooBerry

item.title: African Leopard II
item.description: Big spotted African cat with savannah biome.

item.title: African Leopard II (ES Version)
item.description: Includes 100% Endangered Species design with new features for the African Leopard.

item.title: Aye-Aye
item.description: A unique animal coded by Penguinman and skinned by Electric Eel. ES recommended for optimal performance.

item.title: Baringo Giraffe (ES Version)
item.description: The tallest animal in the world, created for the Endangered Species pack.

item.title: Black and White Ruffed Lemur
item.description: Black and White Ruffed Lemur with two skin variants and original sounds.

item.title: Cameroon Dwarf Goat (ES Version)
item.description: Pygmy goats originally came from West Africa. Includes 100% Endangered Species design with new skin, sound, food, and enrichment.

item.title: Cameroon Dwarf Goat
item.description: Pygmy goats originally came from the Cameroon region of West Africa but are now found as pets in many places.

item.title: Caracal
item.description: A very cute little Caracal created entirely by Exitree.

item.title: Dama Gazelle (ES Version)
item.description: The ES version of one of the gazelles in the Gazelle Pack by SilesianTomcat.

item.title: Spotted Hyena II
item.description: The Spotted Hyena requires the Endangered Species and African Adventure expansions to use.

item.title: Spotted Hyena II
item.description: The Spotted Hyena requires the Endangered Species and African Adventure expansions to use.

item.title: King Cheetah
item.description: A unique cheetah variant with elongated and merged spots.

item.title: Red Ruffed Lemur
item.description: The red ruffed lemur is one of the largest primates of Madagascar, with thick red and black fur.

item.title: Red Ruffed Lemur
item.description: The red ruffed lemur is one of the largest primates of Madagascar, with thick red and black fur.

item.title: Forest Elephant
item.description: A species of elephant native to African rainforests.

item.title: Forest Elephant (ES Version)
item.description: A species of elephant native to African rainforests, featuring new enrichment and sound.

item.title: Klipspringer
item.description: An antelope that bounds from rock to rock.

item.title: Red River Hog
item.description: The Red River Hog is a species of wild pig native to Africa.

item.title: Patas Monkey
item.description: The Patas Monkey is a ground-dwelling monkey distributed over semi-arid areas of West Africa, and into East Africa.

item.title: Impala
item.description: The Impala is a small antelope that lives in the savannahs of Africa.

item.title: Grant's Zebra
item.description: This is a Grant’s Zebra mod for Zoo Tycoon 2, created by DutchDesigns.

item.title: Giant Eland II
item.description: The Giant Eland is a large antelope species native to the savannas of Africa.

item.title: Dwarf Mongoose
item.description: A small, social mongoose species native to Africa. Mod by DutchDesigns.

item.title: Diana Monkey
item.description: The Diana Monkey (Cercopithecus diana) is an Old World monkey found in West Africa.

item.title: Blesbok
item.description: A blesbok made by Gerben and Jannick.

item.title: Aardwolf
item.description: Here is the Aardwolf! This African insectivore is coded by Penguinman and recolored by Exitree. Enjoy!

item.title: Black-Backed Jackal
item.description: These animals are omnivorous and will eat carrion, as well as plants such as grass, fruit, berries and seed.

item.title: Dik-Dik
item.description: The coat of Kirk’s dik-dik is an overall grizzled grey-brown to reddish brown, while the head and legs are tawny in colour.

item.title: Greater Kudu
item.description: This is the Greater Kudu, the second largest antelope in Africa.

item.title: Jackson's Mongoose
item.description: Jackson’s mongooses are typically a greyish or dull brownish in color, with the legs being black.

item.title: Leopard Tortoise
item.description: Leopard tortoises have a huge range, being found on the savannahs of Africa from the Sudan South to the Cape Province of South Africa.

item.title: Zorilla
item.description: The zorilla is a skunk-like mammal that lives in African savannas. It is also called the striped polecat.

item.title: Nubian Ibex
item.description: The Nubian ibex is relatively small compared to other ibexes.

item.title: Lesser Flamingo
item.description: The lesser flamingo is herbivorous, feeding solely on a blue-green algae growing within a very limited range of pH.

item.title: Slender-horned Gazelle
item.description: The slender-horned gazelle is the palest gazelle species, with a cream or yellow-white coloured body.

item.title: Spotted Hyena
item.description: Spotted hyenas are the largest member of the family Hyaenidae. This family also includes three other hyena species.

item.title: Bat Eared Fox
item.description: These foxes live in the scrub, savannah and grasslands of Africa.

item.title: Bonobo
item.description: Bonobos live in the forests located centrally in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (formerly Zaire).

item.title: Nile Monitor Lizard
item.description: The Nile monitor is distributed across most of Africa, except the northwest.

item.title: Fringe Eared Oryx
item.description: The Fringe-Eared Oryx is a scrub dwelling antelope. It is a subspecies of gemsbok native to southern Africa.

item.title: Yellow Mongoose
item.description: An African mongoose. Its main biome is scrub. Will not dig under chain link fences!

item.title: Narrow-Striped Mongoose
item.description: A bushy-tailed mongoose from the dry forests of Madagascar.

item.title: Fanaloka
item.description: New and improved, with 4 different skins and a new model for both adult and baby!

item.title: Giant Eland
item.description: The Largest Species of Antelope - Now Available to Adopt in Your Zoo! Comes with 3 Variant Skins!
